tracks.text: A blue and white plane lies in wreckage on a sandy shore. Elsewhere, girls kiss on the mini bus.
Outside
Dead grab the student outside

Stylized pictures. Rei stares at us from school. Takagi adjusts her glasses from the cat walk. Hirano shoots the modified nail gun. Arisu smiles with Zero. Shizuka thrusts out her ample chest. Saiko grips a samurai sword. Takashi smiles at us.
Poster of the character with the text, Are you ready?
Bullets fall. Text, High School of the Dead
Blood and neon paint splatters
H.O.T.D.
Takashi and Rei stand on a roof. Rei holds a machine gun.
The wind blows their hair. Takashi turns to look at Rei. Rei turns away.
Saya sits on an ornate chair in the middle of a dance floor. She wears a frilly white dress and clutches her knees and looks down. Below her sits a pair of ballet slippers.
Shizuka lies in bed, wearing a loose tank top and thong that frames her ample butt. She looks up and mouths the lyrics, "where"
An American rifle. Rei's thighs squeeze a baton.
Bullets fall. Hirano points a rifle.
Saiko stands in a river of red in front of the Onbetsu bridge. She unsheaths a katana sword.
Takashi stands on the school roof in the rain, looking over the railing. He turns and looks down. Arisu with pink hair holds out purple flowers.
The group of 6 runs across the roof. Saiko strikes a zombie with a boken. She runs, breaks another zombie's arms, gets behind it, strikes its head, and keeps running.
Hirano and Zero stare determinedly. A humvee drives down a highway lined in missing posters. Hirano shoots a gun from the top while Takagi cheers.
Rei runs down the school hallway, striking a zombie with a broom handle. She leaps and split kicks 2 zombies. Takashi swings a bat.
Rei and the purple haired girl embrace with torn clothes. Zombies reach out to them in all directions.
Shizuka runs, her ample breasts bouncing.
Saya lies on a bed, staring at us, knees spread.
Saiko presses her chest against a chain link fence.
Takashi holds flowers and looks up at the gray sky. Blood splatters the sky.
Rain pours on refugee tents. Text, Act 11, DEAD storm rising.
Flashback, dead retainer runs from cage. Soichiro raises a sword. Head floats in fountain. Present, refugee woman gasps then sneers
Saya shakes off her umbrella
Takashi stops her
Takashi's eyes grow wide. He remembers seeing Rei and Hisashi smiling together across a courtyard. Present, he looks down.
Takashi looks ponderous. Saya blinks. Hirano blinks then smiles.
He stares. Saya smiles deviously. Hirano smiles gleefully.
Rain pours over a japanese style mansion on the Takagi estate. A souzu bamboo fountain knocks.
In a room with tatami mat flooring, Saiko seiza kneels opposite Soichiro.
Saiko lifts a 4 foot long sword and slowly unsheaths it.
She carefully eyes the blade.
She sheaths the ornate blade.
Her cheeks warm
Saiko looks down
Takashi sits on a bed in a room with ornate blue wallpaper. He rests his head in his hands.
He turns. Rei stands in her school uniform.
RPG style fantasy. Swordswoman Saiko
Ranger Hirano
Spearwoman Rei.
Sorceress Saya
Priestess Shizuka
Arisu wears a puppy outfit and holds a sword.
She leans against him.
Sitting in his lap, she looks up at him, bringing his hand to her chest. He moves. She falls back on the bed. He leans over her, straddling her body.
She looks to the side, then meets his gaze.
He leans down.
Light reflects on the chandelier.
Takashi sits up.
She stands. He watches her walk away.
She opens the door, enters the hallway, and stops.
Saiko stands, holding the ornate sword.
Rei walks away.
Rain pours on the windows.
Text, High School of the DEAD
Rain falls over a barricade on a suburban road. Men in ponchos look over a barbed wire fence as the mini bus pulls up. A guard stares as a girl leans out, her wet cleavage bouncing.
The guard stares and blushes.
In the driver seat, Shido smiles.
Takagi estate, office
Takashi loads gear. Rei approaches.
They turn to see Saiko, in her school shirt, slit skirt, and samurai sword.
She blinks ignorantly
She pats her sword
Rei turns
She deploys her bayonet and runs.
Shido frowns
Flashback, a middle aged man stands on top of a gaisensha campaign van.
Woman cries near bottles
funeral
Present
Rei points the gun at Shido's face
Takashi watches
She presses the bayonet to Shido's face
Takashi lurches, then stops
Rei stares at him intently.
Shido smiles nervously at the bayonet inches from his face.
Takashi and Saiko wear hard expressions. Shizuka cover's Arisu's eyes. Zero glares. Hirano looks worried. Yuriko stares blankly. Saya stares uneasily.
Rei lowers the gun.
Shido stands frozen, arms outstretched, in the rain.
Hirano and Saya sigh. Saiko and Takashi smile.
Rei turns and walks away.
Rei enters the house. Shido stands in the rain, head down, arms limp, fists clenched, teeth gritted, seething.
The bus drives off. A gate closes behind them.
At the front porch, Rei looks at the sun breaking through the clouds.
At night, a submarine floats just under the surface of the ocean.
A white captain dons a lanyard. He turns to a black officer.
The black officer nods. The captain picks up a phone.
Officers glance at each other. A Lieutenant Commander puts a key on his lanyard into a lock.
The captain and lieutenant turn their keys in sync. A missile emerges from the submarine and rises to the surface of the ocean.
It emerges from the ocean and rockets into the sky.
Text, Act 11, DEAD storm rising
outro
On the International Space Station, astronauts look at a computer.
The blond woman floats over to the brown haired man.
A heatmap shows a dark spot growing in real time. The woman's eyes shimmer.
She looks down then kicks away.
The man runs his fingers through his hair. The missile flies through the sky.
4 missiles rise from the south pacific.
Text, to be continued
Text, Preview
Text, Act 12, All DEAD'S attack.

Post-episode footnote: Gaisensha, spelled street + proclamation + vehicle, are typically translated to english as sound trucks or propaganda trucks. These vehicles are usually vans with speakers and signage mounted to the top, and are used for commercial and political campaigns. In a commercial context, these vans may drive around the city, playing jingles for ice cream, soap, or beer. In a political context, interest groups may play recorded messages. Some vehicles come equiped with stages on the top, and candidates will stand on the stage and speak the populace in front of parks, town centers, or station entrances. Gaisensha are a staple of urban living, especially during election season for all levels of government.
